projectPurpose: To enable the use of affordable e-ink display modules with IT8915 controllers as functional, low-latency computer monitors, particularly optimized for tasks like coding and writing, offering a cost-effective alternative to dedicated e-ink monitors.
mainFeatures: Supports e-ink screens with IT8915 USB controllers.
Low-latency mode suitable for coding and writing.
Supports a gray mode with 16 levels and Floyd-Steinberg dithering.
Can be configured as a secondary monitor.
Techniques to reduce perceived latency and optimize display for e-ink.

alternatives.name: DASUNG Paperlike
mainFeatures: Intended for use as primary or secondary displays.

alternatives.name: PaperTTY
mainFeatures: Uses e-ink displays as a TTY/terminal.

alternatives.name: Waveshare E-Paper IT8951 driver board
mainFeatures: Hardware driver board for e-paper displays.
Provides SDKs or examples for interaction.
Supports displays using the IT8951 controller.

marketPositioning: RabbitInk is positioned as a cost-effective, open-source alternative to expensive commercial e-ink monitors. It targets users willing to purchase separate e-ink display modules with IT8915 controllers and who have some technical ability for setup. Its focus is on providing a functional, low-latency graphical display experience optimized for coding and writing, differentiating itself from text-only solutions and higher-cost plug-and-play monitors.
